article_caption: An African elephant in the wild

article_paragraphs.text: Elephants are the biggest land animals in the world. They are famous for their big ears and long noses. An elephant's nose is called a trunk. Elephants use their trunks to drink water and pick up food. They also use them to say hello to other elephants.

Elephants are very intelligent. They have good memories and can remember places and other animals for a long time. They live in large families. The oldest female elephant is usually the leader. She shows the family where to find food and water.

Sadly, elephants are in danger. People hunt them for their tusks. We need to protect these beautiful animals. Many people are working hard to save the forests where elephants live so they can be safe and happy.
